item.title: Katherine add a quote by Laura Nyro
item.description: "Give me my freedom for as long as I be. All I ask of living is to have no chains on me. All I ask of living is to have no chains on me, And all I ask of dying is to go naturally." -- Laura Nyro

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "On ne voit bien qu'avec le cœur. L'essentiel est invisible pour les yeux." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Voltaire
Katherine add a quote by Max Ehrmann
item.description: "With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams, it is still a beautiful world. Be cheerful. Strive to be happy." -- Max Ehrmann

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music he hears, however measured or far away." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Flann O'Brien
item.description: "I mean to say, whether a yarn is tall or small I like to hear it well told. I like to meet a man that can take in hand to tell a story and not make a balls of it while he's at it. I like to know where I am, do you know. Everything has a beginning and an end." -- Flann O'Brien

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "One morning I shot an elephant in my pajamas. How he got in my pajamas I'll never know." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Christopher J. J. Nolan
item.description: "Sometimes people deserve to have their faith rewarded." -- Christopher J. J. Nolan

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "Does the open wound in another's breast soften the pain of the gaping wound in our own? Or does the blood which is welling from another man's side staunch that which is pouring from our own? Does the general anguish of our fellow creatures lessen our own private and particular anguish? No, no, each suffers on his own account, each struggles with his own grief, each sheds his own tears." -- Alexandre Dumas
